subject: Self Care
title: Sleep Hygiene Basics
description: A 60-second lesson on Sleep Hygiene Basics.

hook.text: Sleep hygiene isn't about cleanliness. It's the set of habits that make good sleep almost automatic.

buildup.text: Same bedtime, same wake time, even on weekends. Consistency trains your circadian clock to cooperate.

discovery.text: Dark room, cool air, no screens. These three physical conditions cover 80% of sleep environment needs.

twist.text: Most people know these rules and ignore them. Knowledge without consistency changes nothing at all.

climax.text: Pick one habit and practice it every night for two weeks. Small consistency beats big ambition.

punchline.text: Sleep hygiene works â€” but only if you do it.

quiz.question: What is the most important aspect of sleep hygiene?
options: Consistent bedtime and wake time every day
